entry.title: XAMPP for Windows • Re: Responsive designs not working properly with XAMPP in IE
entry.content:
You sir, are a genius. I went into the IE compatibility view settings, and there was a little box at the bottom "view all intranet sites in compatibility view" checked.

Unchecked it and it works like a charm. Thanks!

entry.title: XAMPP for Windows • Re: Responsive designs not working properly with XAMPP in IE
entry.content: It may be the browser in "intranet" mode causing compatibility issues.<hr />

entry.title: XAMPP for Windows • Responsive designs not working properly with XAMPP in IE
entry.content:
This is an extremely odd problem, I originally thought it was a wordpress problem so I installed joomla instead and it does the same thing.

What happens is that any theme or template that is designed to be responsive is completely locked into its "mobile" version when viewed in any version of IE. Tested on 9, 10, and 11. Of course, they all work fine in Firefox. I tried completely uninstalling wordpress, joomla, and XAMPP itself. Reinstalled, left everything on all installations at the default settings, it still does it.

Any ideas?
